page.title: 12Churches.
page.content: Market Lavington church which is called{St. Mary's,}is on the west side of the village.It was built about 600 years ago but a church was there before.Nothing of the first wooden {Saxon}church remains but there are {Norman}stone carvings in the porch.The church is made of stone with a lead roof.There are 6 bells and inside 57 pews.Ten services are held each week with a collection total of Â£95_Â£100.Five people so far have been baptised this year. The{Trinity Church}in Market Lavington is in the old chapel building.This is made of brick and has no bells.Three services are held each week.One for ladies only,but with a different vicar each week.In West Lavington there is{All Saints Church and in Easterton{St.Barnabas Church.
